titleStmt.title: To CHARLES KENT, 9 OCTOBER 1866
titleStmt.bibl: Charles Dickens Letters Project, ed. Leon Litvack, Katie Brandt, Emily Bell, and Jeremy Parrott (London: Dickens Fellowship), DickensLetters.com.

sourceDesc.p: MS Gotshall Collection, New York State Library.

dateline.placeName: OFFICE OF ALL THE YEAR ROUND,

body.p: My Dear Kent. Not the slightest notion of dressing. No such thing is ever done here â€“ come at 1/2 past 6 this evening.Dickens had written the day before, saying he must stay in the Office for the next two days, but asking Kent to dine with him either on Tuesday or Wednesday: see Pilgrim Letters 11, p. 253.
